title: IPL 2025 points table and top run-scorers & wicket-takers
description: The IPL 2025 is in full swing, but who is leading the race for the orange and purple cap? BBC Sport looks at the top run-scorers and wicket-takers in the 18th edition.
excerpt: The IPL 2025 is in full swing, but who is leading the race for the orange and purple cap? BBC Sport looks at the top run-scorers and wicket-takers in the 18th edition.

The key batters and bowlers are standing out in the 18th edition of the world's biggest T20 franchise league.BBC Sport takes a look at all the key stats - and past winners of the orange and purple caps. html:
IPL 2025 points table and top run-scorers & wicket-takers

The 2025 Indian Premier League (IPL) is in full swing with the group stages now past the halfway stage.

The key batters and bowlers are standing out in the 18th edition of the world's biggest T20 franchise league.

BBC Sport takes a look at all the key stats - and past winners of the orange and purple caps.

IPL 2025 orange cap: Who is highest run-scorer?

1. Sai Sudharsan (Gujarat Titans) - 417 runs

2. Virat Kohli (Royal Challengers Bengaluru) - 392

3. Nicholas Pooran (Lucknow Super Giants) - 377

4. Suryakumar Yadav (Mumbai Indians) - 373

5. Jos Buttler (Gujarat Titans) - 356

IPL 2025 purple cap: Who is highest wicket-taker?

1. Prasidh Krishna (Gujarat Titans), Josh Hazlewood (Royal Challengers Bengaluru) - 16 wickets

=3. Noor Ahmad (Chennai Super Kings), Kuldeep Yadav (Delhi Capitals), Hardik Pandya (Mumbai Indians), Krunal Pandya (Royal Challengers Bengaluru), Shardul Thakur (Lucknow Super Giants), Mohammed Siraj & Sai Kishore (both Gujarat Titans) - 12

Previous winners of IPL orange and purple cap

IPL 2025 batting stats: Highest strike-rate, average & most sixes

Highest strike-rate

Minimum 20 balls faced

1. Vipraj Nigam (Delhi Capitals) - 207.69

2. Rahul Tewatia (Gujarat Titans) - 205.00

3. Nicholas Pooran (Lucknow Super Giants) - 204.89

4. Priyansh Arya (Punjab Kings) - 201.58

5. Abdul Samad (Lucknow Super Giants) - 194.82

Highest average

1. Tim David (Royal Challengers Bengaluru) - 82.50

2. Jos Buttler (Gujarat Titans) - 71.20

3. Virat Kohli (Royal Challengers Bengaluru) - 65.33

4. KL Rahul (Delhi Capitals) - 64.60

5. Suryakumar Yadav (Mumbai Indians) - 62.16

Most sixes

1. Nicholas Pooran (Lucknow Super Giants) - 31 sixes

=2. Shreyas Iyer (Punjab Kings), Yashasvi Jaiswal (Rajasthan Royals) - 20

4. Suryakumar Yadav (Mumbai Indians) - 19

=5. Priyansh Arya (Punjab Kings) & Mitchell Marsh (Lucknow Super Giants) - 18

IPL 2025 bowling stats: Best strike-rate, average & economy

Best strike-rate

1. Andre Russell (Kolkata Knight Riders) - 7.50

4. Prasidh Krishna (Gujarat Titans) - 11.62

5. Sai Kishore (Gujarat Titans) - 11.91

Best average

2. Prasidh Krishna (Gujarat Titans) - 14.12

3. Kamindu Mendis (Sunrisers Hyderabad) - 16.00

4. Sai Kishore (Gujarat Titans) - 16.33

5. Andre Russell (Kolkata Knight Riders) - 16.83

Best economy

Minimum of 24 balls bowled

2. Varun Chakravarthy (Kolkata Knight Riders) - 6.48

3. Kuldeep Yadav (Delhi Capitals) - 6.50

4. Will Jacks (Mumbai Indians) - 6.66

5. Digvesh Rathi (Lucknow Super Giants) - 7.27
